questions.question: What is the core principle of Agile software development?
answers: To deliver complete software at the end of the project.
To follow a strict plan with little flexibility.
To build software incrementally with customer feedback.
To prioritize documentation over working software.

questions.question: In Agile, what is a user story?
answers: A detailed technical specification of a feature.
A feature described from an end-user perspective.
A test case for validating a feature.

questions.question: What is the primary role of the Product Owner in Scrum?
answers: To represent the customer's interest and prioritize the backlog.
To remove obstacles for the team.

questions.question: Which of these is a key Scrum ceremony?
In Scrum, how is the work for a Sprint determined?
answers: The team selects items from the Product Backlog during Sprint Planning.

questions.question: What is an essential characteristic of a well-written SRS document according to IEEE standards?
answers: Overly detailed to cover every scenario.

questions.question: What is the main goal of a code review?
answers: To find and fix mistakes before they become part of the product.
To assign tasks to the development team.

questions.question: According to studies, what is a common outcome of implementing code reviews?
answers: Increased number of bugs in production.

questions.question: What role do unit tests play in Agile development?
answers: They replace the need for customer feedback.
They are used only at the final stage of development.
They ensure individual components work as intended, facilitating continuous integration.
They are optional and rarely used in Agile development.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of version control systems?
answers: To record changes to files over time.
To minimize collaboration among team members.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the System Requirement Review (SRR)?
answers: To ensure all system requirements are defined and agreed upon
To begin the software development phase
To assign tasks to the development team

questions.question: What types of errors are commonly identified during requirement analysis?
What is a key goal of the SRR?
answers: To present the final software product
To review and verify the system's functionality and technologies
To conduct performance evaluations of the development team

questions.question: What does the Model component represent in MVC architecture?
answers: The user interface and user experience
The core functionality and data of the application

questions.question: What role does the View component play in MVC?
answers: It displays the user interface and presents data

questions.question: In Git, what does a 'commit' represent?
answers: A change in the project's documentation
A new version of the software
A record of changes made to the repository
A backup of the entire project

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a code review?
answers: To find and fix mistakes before they become part of the product
To assign tasks to the development team

questions.question: How do code reviews contribute to software security?
answers: By adding more features to the software
By finding and removing common vulnerabilities
By increasing the number of bugs

questions.question: What is a key feature of distributed version control systems (DVCS)?
answers: Ability for every user to have a full backup of the repository

questions.question: What is a common outcome of code reviews according to industry case studies?
answers: Increased number of bugs in production
Reduced development resources by a significant percentage

questions.question: What is the primary goal of unit testing in software development?
answers: To validate the design of the software
To ensure that individual units of source code work as intended
To assess the performance of the software under load
To verify the final product meets customer requirements

questions.question: What does JUnit provide for Java programming?
answers: A set of performance optimization tools
A graphical user interface for software design
A framework for writing and running tests

questions.question: Which JUnit annotation is used to specify a method that should be executed before each test method?
What is the purpose of the @Ignore annotation in JUnit?
answers: To mark a test that should be executed first
To temporarily disable a test without deleting its code
To indicate that a test method is expecting an exception
To document the reason for test failure

questions.question: How do stubs and drivers relate to unit testing?
answers: Stubs and drivers are alternative names for test cases and test suites
They are tools used to measure the performance of unit tests
Stubs and drivers are dummy modules used in integration testing
They refer to types of assertions in JUnit

questions.question: What is the main benefit of using design patterns in software development?
answers: To reduce the size of the codebase
To increase the execution speed of applications
To provide solutions to common software design problems
To eliminate the need for software testing

questions.question: Which design pattern is primarily used to create an object while hiding the creation logic?
In the context of the MVC pattern, what does the Controller component do?
answers: It displays the application's user interface
It transforms data for the View component

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the Singleton pattern?
answers: To ensure a class has only one instance
To allow an object to alter its behavior when its internal state changes
To separate the construction of a complex object from its representation
To adapt an interface of a class into another interface clients expect

questions.question: How does the Strategy pattern benefit software design?
answers: By providing a more efficient algorithm for sorting data
By ensuring that objects are always created in a safe manner
By enabling the definition of a family of algorithms and making them interchangeable
By reducing the overall number of objects in the system

questions.question: What is the primary measure of progress in Agile methodologies?
Which of the following best describes an Agile approach to software development?
answers: Sequential phases with little customer involvement

questions.question: What is a key characteristic of a well-defined software requirement?
In the context of software development, what does SRS stand for?
How are surveys typically used in the software development process?
answers: To gather user feedback on features
To decide on the programming languages used

questions.question: What is an important consideration when designing a survey for user feedback?
answers: Limiting the number of questions to five

questions.question: What is the primary goal of software architecture?
answers: To outline the best coding practices
To define the system's structure and behavior
To detail the user interface design

questions.question: Which pattern separates the system into three interconnected components?
What is the primary focus of software maintenance?
answers: Adding new features to the system
Both adding new features and correcting defects

questions.question: Which type of software maintenance involves making changes to improve system performance?
What is the main purpose of regression testing?
answers: To ensure that changes have not broken existing functionality
To test the system on different platforms

questions.question: In unit testing, what is typically the scope of a test case?
